intro: Hypericum kinashianum var. yuhudakense, commonly known as the Yuhudak hypericum, is a rare shrub native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the genus Hypericum, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are characterized by their bright orange petals and yellow stamens. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
